comments:
I am using 3.0 M6.

Each time I tried just moving a View to another position, a blank window 
popped up.  I shut down Eclipse, but couldn't start it up again.  It 
complained with some error (that I unfortunately didn't write down) that said 
to look in the log file for details.  The log output follows (I didn't know 
how much was critical, so I figured that more was better than not enough -- 
hope it all gets through ;-)

In any case, I had to delete my configuration (workspace\.metadata\.plugins) 
so Eclipse could launch again!  Somehow, just moving that View corrupted my 
whole config!

Let me know if you need more info.
Ari

Portion of .log output:

The NPE is probably a follow up of the first error you got.
Try to delete the .config directory.

Fixed NPE problem in AnnotationRulerColumn.
Available in builds > 20040127.

Moving back to Platform UI regarding the initial error.

Now that the NPE is fixed, I'm reducing the severity of this PR.  Are you 
still seeing the blank window showing up when you try to move a view (i.e. in 
a build which has the NPE fixed)?

Which view was being moved?

The error it gave you should have been something like "Error restoring 
workbench state".  It should have let you proceed, but probably would have lost 
your UI state (open windows/perspectives/views).  It should not have lost, or 
required you to delete, your entire metadata area.

If you can provide mroe details about what you were doing in the UI, that would 
help.
After this problem, I reverted to 2.12 -- sorry I cannot provide more info.

There's too little info to go on for the corruption.
Marking as fixed in 3.0 for the NPE.
